column4: Further information on status and recognition of sovereignty[d]

column1: Algeria – People's Democratic Republic of Algeria

column4: Andorra is a co-principality in which the office of head of state is jointly held ex officio by the French president and the bishop of the Roman Catholic diocese of Urgell, who himself is appointed with approval from the Holy See.
Antigua and Barbuda is a Commonwealth realm
Argentina is a federation of 23 provinces and one autonomous city.
Armenia is not recognised by Pakistan due to the dispute over Artsakh.

Australia is a Commonwealth realm and a federation of both states and territories. There are six states, three internal territories, six external territories and one claimed Antarctic external territory. The external territories of Australia are:  Ashmore and Cartier Islands  Christmas Island  Cocos (Keeling) Islands  Coral Sea Islands Territory  Heard Island and McDonald Islands  Norfolk Island  Australian Antarctic Territory
Member of the European Union. Austria is a federation of nine states.
Azerbaijan contains one autonomous region, Nakhchivan  The de facto state of Artsakh has been established in the southwest of Azerbaijan.

column1: Bahamas, The – Commonwealth of The Bahamas
column4: The Bahamas is a Commonwealth realm.
Barbados is a Commonwealth realm.
Member of the EU. Belgium is a federation of three linguistic communities and three regions.
Belize is a Commonwealth realm.
Bosnia and Herzegovina has two constituent entities:  Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina  Republika Srpska and Brčko District, a self-governing administrative district.
Brazil is a federation of 26 states and one federal district.

column1: Brunei – Nation of Brunei, the Abode of Peace

column4: Member of the EU.
Canada is a Commonwealth realm and a federation of 10 provinces and three territories.

column1: Cape Verde – Republic of Cabo Verde

column4: China contains five autonomous regions, Guangxi, Inner Mongolia, Ningxia, Tibet, and Xinjiang.
Comoros is a federation of three islands.

column1: Costa Rica – Republic of Costa Rica

column4: Member of the EU.
Member of the EU. The northeastern part of the island is the de facto state of Northern Cyprus. Cyprus is not recognised by Turkey due to the Cyprus dispute, with Turkey recognising Northern Cyprus.
Member of the EU.
Member of the EU.

column1: East Timor – Democratic Republic of Timor-Leste
El Salvador – Republic of El Salvador
Equatorial Guinea – Republic of Equatorial Guinea

column4: Member of the EU.

column1: Ethiopia – Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia
column4: Ethiopia is a federation of nine regions and two chartered cities.
Fiji contains one autonomous region, Rotuma.
Member of the EU.
Member of the EU.

column1: Gambia, The – Republic of The Gambia

column4: Georgia contains two autonomous republics, Adjara and Abkhazia. In Abkhazia and South Ossetia, de facto states have been formed.
Member of the EU. Germany is a federation of 16 states.
Member of the EU.
Grenada is a Commonwealth realm.
Member of the EU.
India is a federation of 28 states and eight union territories.
Indonesia has five autonomous provinces, Aceh, Jakarta, Papua, West Papua, and Yogyakarta.
Iraq is a federation
Member of the EU.

Israel exerts strong control over the territory claimed by Palestine. Israel annexed East Jerusalem, Israel is not recognised as a state by 32 UN members and the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic. The Palestine Liberation Organization, which enjoys recognition by a majority of UN member states as the sole representative of the Palestinian people, also does not recognise Israel.
Member of the EU.

column1: Ivory Coast – Republic of Côte d'Ivoire

column4: Jamaica is a Commonwealth realm.

column1: Korea, North – Democratic People's Republic of Korea
column4: North Korea is not recognised by three UN members, France, Japan, and South Korea, the last of which claims to be the sole legitimate government of Korea.
South Korea has one autonomous region, Jejudo. South Korea is not recognised by North Korea, which claims to be the sole legitimate government of Korea.
Member of the EU.
Member of the EU.
Member of the EU.
Malaysia is a federation of 13 states and three federal territories.
Member of the EU.

column1: Marshall Islands – Republic of the Marshall Islands
column4: Under Compact of Free Association with the United States.
Mauritius has an autonomous island, Rodrigues.
Mexico is a federation of 31 states and one autonomous city. The Rebel Zapatista Autonomous Municipalities have de facto autonomy.
Under Compact of Free Association with the United States. The Federated States of Micronesia is a federation of four states.
Moldova has the autonomous regions of Gagauzia and Transnistria autonomous territorial unit. The latter is under the de facto control of Transnistria.
Part of the Moroccan-claimed Western Sahara is controlled by the partially recognised Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic.

column1: Myanmar – Republic of the Union of Myanmar
column4: Wa State is a de facto autonomous state within Myanmar.

column1: Nepal – Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal
column4: Nepal is a federation composed of 7 provinces.
Member of the EU. The Kingdom of the Netherlands as a whole is a member of the EU, but EU law applies only to parts within Europe.
New Zealand is a Commonwealth realm, and are members of some UN specialized agencies.
Nicaragua contains two autonomous regions, Atlántico Sur and Atlántico Norte.
Nigeria is a federation of 36 states and one federal territory.

column1: North Macedonia – Republic of North Macedonia

column4: Norway has two unincorporated areas in Europe:  Svalbard is an integral part of Norway, but has a special status due to the Svalbard Treaty.  Jan Mayen is an uninhabited island that is an integral part of Norway, although unincorporated. Norway has one dependent territory and two claimed Antarctic dependent territories in the Southern Hemisphere:  Bouvet Island  Peter I Island  Queen Maud Land
Pakistan is a federation of four provinces and one capital territory. Pakistan exercises control over certain portions of Kashmir, but has not officially annexed any of it,
Under Compact of Free Association with the United States.

column2: UN observer state; member of 2 UN specialized agencies
column4: The State of Palestine, declared in 1988, is not recognised as a state by Israel and has received diplomatic recognition from 138 states. UNIDO, and an observer state in the UN.

column1: Papua New Guinea – Independent State of Papua New Guinea
column4: Papua New Guinea is a Commonwealth realm
The Philippines contains one autonomous region, Bangsamoro.
Member of the EU.
Member of the EU.
Member of the EU.
Russia is a federation of 85 federal subjects (republics, oblasts, krais, autonomous okrugs, federal cities, and an autonomous oblast). Several of the federal subjects are ethnic republics.

column1: Saint Kitts and Nevis – Federation of Saint Christopher and Nevis
column4: Saint Kitts and Nevis is a Commonwealth realm of two islands, St. Kitts and Nevis.
Saint Lucia is a Commonwealth realm.
Saint Vincent and the Grenadines is a Commonwealth realm.

column1: San Marino – Republic of San Marino
São Tomé and Príncipe – Democratic Republic of São Tomé and Príncipe
column4: São Tomé and Príncipe contains one autonomous province, Príncipe.

column1: Saudi Arabia – Kingdom of Saudi Arabia

column4: Serbia contains two autonomous regions, Vojvodina and Kosovo and Metohija. The latter is under the de facto control of Kosovo.

column1: Sierra Leone – Republic of Sierra Leone

column4: Member of the EU.
Member of the EU.
The Solomon Islands is a Commonwealth realm.
Somalia is a federation of six states. Two, Puntland and Galmudug, have self-declared autonomy, while one, Somaliland, is de facto independent.

column1: South Africa – Republic of South Africa
South Sudan – Republic of South Sudan
column4: South Sudan is a federation of 10 states and three administrative areas. The Abyei Area is a zone with "special administrative status" established by the Comprehensive Peace Agreement in 2005. It is de jure a condominium of South Sudan and Sudan, but de facto administered by two competing administrations and the United Nations.
Member of the EU.

column1: Sri Lanka – Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka

column4: Sudan is a federation of 18 states. The Abyei Area is a zone with "special administrative status" established by the Comprehensive Peace Agreement in 2005. It is de jure a condominium of South Sudan and Sudan, but de facto administered by two competing administrations and the United Nations.
Member of the EU.
Switzerland is a federation of 26 cantons.

The Syrian National Coalition, which is recognised as the legitimate representative of the Syrian people by 20 UN members, has established an interim government to rule rebel controlled territory during the Syrian civil war. Syria has one self-declared autonomous region: Rojava.
Tajikistan contains one autonomous region, Gorno-Badakhshan Autonomous Province.
Tanzania contains one autonomous region, Zanzibar.

column1: Trinidad and Tobago – Republic of Trinidad and Tobago
column4: Trinidad and Tobago contains one autonomous region, Tobago.
Tuvalu is a Commonwealth realm.
Ukraine contains one autonomous region, the Autonomous Republic of Crimea, however it is under the de facto control of Russia.
The United Arab Emirates is a federation of seven emirates.

column1: United Kingdom – United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
column4: Former EU member in transition. consisting of four constituent countries; England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, and Wales. The United Kingdom has the following 13 overseas territories and one claimed Antarctic dependent territory:  Akrotiri and Dhekelia  Anguilla  Bermuda  British Indian Ocean Territory  British Virgin Islands  Cayman Islands  Falkland Islands  Gibraltar  Montserrat  Pitcairn Islands  Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha  South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands  Turks and Caicos Islands  British Antarctic Territory The British monarch also has direct sovereignty over three self-governing Crown dependencies:  Guernsey  Isle of Man  Jersey

column1: United States – United States of America
column4: The United States is a federation of 50 states, one federal district, and one incorporated territory. Additionally, the Federal government of the United States has sovereignty over 13 unincorporated territories. Of these territories, the following five are inhabited possessions:  American Samoa  Guam  Northern Mariana Islands  Puerto Rico  U.S. Virgin Islands It also has sovereignty over several uninhabited territories:  Baker Island  Howland Island  Jarvis Island  Johnston Atoll  Kingman Reef  Midway Atoll  Navassa Island  Wake Island It also disputes sovereignty over the following two territories:  Bajo Nuevo Bank  Serranilla Bank Three sovereign states have become associated states of the United States under the Compact of Free Association:  Marshall Islands – Republic of the Marshall Islands  Micronesia – Federated States of Micronesia  Palau – Republic of Palau
Uzbekistan contains one autonomous region, Karakalpakstan.

column2: UN observer state under the designation of "Holy See"; member of three UN specialized agencies and the IAEA
column4: Administered by the Holy See, a sovereign entity with diplomatic relations to 183 states. This figure consists of 180 UN member states, the Cook Islands, the Republic of China (Taiwan), and the State of Palestine. and multiple other UN System organizations. The Vatican City is governed by officials appointed by the Pope, who is the Bishop of the Diocese of Rome and ex officio sovereign of Vatican City.
Venezuela is a federation of 23 states, one capital district, and federal dependencies.
Recognised by Russia, Nauru, Nicaragua, Syria, Venezuela, Artsakh, South Ossetia and Transnistria. Claimed in whole by Georgia as the Autonomous Republic of Abkhazia.
A de facto independent state,

A state in free association with New Zealand, the Cook Islands maintains diplomatic relations with 52 states. The Cook Islands is a member of multiple UN agencies with full treaty making capacity. It shares a head of state with New Zealand as well as having shared citizenship.

Pursuant to United Nations Security Council Resolution 1244, Kosovo was placed under the administration of the United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo in 1999. Serbia continues to maintain its sovereignty claim over Kosovo. Other UN member states and non UN member states continue to recognise Serbian sovereignty or have taken no position on the question. Kosovo is a member of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank Group. The Republic of Kosovo has de facto control over most of the territory, with limited control in North Kosovo.

A state in free association with New Zealand, Niue maintains diplomatic relations with 20 states. Niue is a member of multiple UN agencies with full treaty making capacity. It shares a head of state with New Zealand as well as having shared citizenship.

column1: Northern Cyprus – Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus
column4: Recognised only by Turkey. Under the name "Turkish Cypriot State", it is an observer state of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation and the Economic Cooperation Organization. Northern Cyprus is claimed in whole by the Republic of Cyprus.

Recognised at some stage by 84 UN member states, 45 of which have since withdrawn or frozen their recognition. It is a founding member of the African Union and the Asian–African Strategic Partnership formed at the 2005 Asian–African Conference. The territories under its control, the so-called Free Zone, are claimed in whole by Morocco as part of its Southern Provinces. In turn, the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic claims the part of Western Sahara to the west of the Moroccan Wall controlled by Morocco. Its government resides in exile in Tindouf, Algeria.
A de facto independent state,

column1: South Ossetia – Republic of South Ossetia–the State of Alania
column4: A de facto independent state,

column2: Former UN member (as Republic of China, 1945–1971)Observer in one UN specialized agency under the name "Chinese Taipei"
column4: A state competing (nominally) for recognition with the People's Republic of China (PRC) as the government of China since 1949. The Republic of China (ROC) controls the island of Taiwan and associated islands, Quemoy, Matsu, the Pratas and parts of the Spratly Islands, and has not renounced claims over its annexed territories on the mainland. The ROC participates in international organizations under a variety of pseudonyms, most commonly "Chinese Taipei" and in the WTO it has full membership. The ROC was a founding member of the UN and enjoyed membership from 1945 to 1971, with veto power in the UN Security Council. See China and the United Nations.
A de facto independent state,
